conclusion: The graph of 1/v versus x is a straight line.
The slope of the line represents the rate of change of 1/v with respect to x.
If the slope is positive, 1/v increases with x, implying v decreases.
A positive slope indicates the particle is undergoing deceleration.
Acceleration a can be expressed as the derivative of velocity v with respect to time t.
Velocity v is the derivative of displacement x with respect to time t.
Acceleration a can be expressed as v * dv/dx.
Given 1/v = mx + c, rearranging gives v = 1/(mx + c).
Differentiating v with respect to x gives dv/dx = -m/(mx + c)^2.
Since m is positive, dv/dx is negative, indicating v decreases as x increases.
Conclusion: The particle is undergoing deceleration as the slope of the 1/v versus x graph is positive.
